title: 10 Best Songs For a Rainy Day
text:
By Bill Lamb 
What is it about rain that inspires pop songwriters? Rain songs are some of the most memorable and intensely emotional of pop hits. These are 10 of the best. They are of course best listened to with the patter of raindrops on your window pane. Courtesy Atlantic Buy from Amazon 
With the single line, "I believe it's rainin' all over the world," soul legend Brook Benton brings the melancholy spirit of the rain home. This record went to #4 on the pop singles chart in 1970 and was the last of Brook Benton 's top 10 pop hits. It also reached #2 on the adult contemporary chart. The song was originally written by Louisiana singer-songwriter Tony Joe White in 1967. 
"Neon signs a-flashin', taxi cabs and buses passin' through the nightA distant moanin' of a train seems to play a sad refrain to the nightA rainy night in Georgia, such a rainy night in GeorgiaLord, I believe it's rainin' all over the worldI feel like it's rainin' all over the world" 
continue reading below our video 5 Urban Myths That Rule the Ages Eurythmics - "Here Comes the Rain Again". Courtesy RCA Buy from Amazon 
The Eurythmics gave us the sound of synthesized rain swirled in with the powerful emotion of unrequited love. The string arrangements in the song were performed by members of the British Philharmonic Orchestra. This was the Eurythmics' second top 10 pop hit in the US landing at #4 in 1984. It also reached the top 10 on both the adult contemporary and dance charts. 
"Here comes the rain againFalling on my head like a memoryFalling on my head like a new emotionI want to walk in the open windI want to talk like lovers doI want to dive into your oceanIs it raining with you?"
